commands.publish.started.customlan: Local game hosted on port %s with MOTD: %s
commands.publish.failed.port_change: Unable to change port, still listening on port %s
commands.publish.saved: Local game hosting settings saved with port %s and MOTD: %s
commands.ban.failed.host: Nothing changed. You cannot ban the server's host
commands.banip.failed.host: Nothing changed. You cannot ban the IP of the server's host
commands.whitelist.add.failed.host: You cannot whitelist the server's host
lanServer.explanation:
To allow/disallow a player (including yourself) to use commands, use the /op and /deop commands.
Tip: This works without opening to LAN as well!
You can also ban and whitelist players using the respective commands.
lanServer.clear.perWorld.question: Are you sure you want to clear the saved settings for this world?
lanServer.clear.global.question: Are you sure you want to clear the global settings?
lanServer.maxPlayers.invalid:
Not a valid number of players.
Please enter a number greater than %s.
lanServer.motd.description:
You can use ampersands (&&) instead of section signs to enter formatting codes (use two ampersands in a row to get an actual ampersand).
The following variables will be expanded:
$${username} - the host's username (${username})
$${world} - the world's name (${world})
